title: Build pytorch failed with error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined
body_html:
🐛 Bug

To Reproduce

I try to build pytorch from source as instructions at https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile
I run the following commands:

git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git && cd pytorch

git submodule update --init --recursive

python setup.py install

The last step failed.

Error Message

But the build failed. The error messages are listed as follows:
[ 61%] Building CXX object caffe2/torch/lib/THD/CMakeFiles/THD.dir/base/data_channels/DataChannelGloo.cpp.o
/home/xx/tools/pytorch/c10/Half-inl.h(21): error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined

1 error detected in the compilation of "/tmp/tmpxft_00002b65_00000000-7_THCBlas.cpp1.ii".
CMake Error at caffe2_gpu_generated_THCBlas.cu.o.Release.cmake:279 (message):
Error generating file
/home/xx/tools/pytorch/build/caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/__/aten/src/THC/./caffe2_gpu_generated_THCBlas.cu.o

make[2]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/__/aten/src/THC/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCBlas.cu.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
[ 61%] Building CXX object caffe2/torch/lib/THD/CMakeFiles/THD.dir/base/data_channels/DataChannelNccl.cpp.o
/home/xx/tools/pytorch/c10/Half-inl.h(21): error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined

[ 61%] Building CXX object caffe2/torch/lib/THD/CMakeFiles/THD.dir/base/data_channels/DataChannelTCP.cpp.o
/home/xx/tools/pytorch/c10/Half-inl.h(21): error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined

/home/xx/tools/pytorch/c10/Half-inl.h(21): error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined

Environment

  • PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): commit 8fafa7b
  • OS (e.g., Linux):CentOS release 6.6 (Final)
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): described above
  • Python version:Python 3.6.7 :: Anaconda
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 7.5
  • GPU models and configuration: Nvidis Tesla K40m
  • Any other relevant information:
    gcc version: gcc (GCC) 4.8.2

Additional context

To Reproduce

body:
## 🐛 Bug

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

## To Reproduce
I try to build pytorch from source as instructions at https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile
I run the following commands:
#### git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git && cd pytorch
#### git submodule update --init --recursive
#### python setup.py install
The last step failed.
<!-- If you have a code sample, error messages, stack traces, please provide it here as well -->

## Error Message
But the build failed. The error messages are listed as follows:
[ 61%] Building CXX object caffe2/torch/lib/THD/CMakeFiles/THD.dir/base/data_channels/DataChannelGloo.cpp.o
/home/xx/tools/pytorch/c10/Half-inl.h(21): error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined

1 error detected in the compilation of "/tmp/tmpxft_00002b65_00000000-7_THCBlas.cpp1.ii".
CMake Error at caffe2_gpu_generated_THCBlas.cu.o.Release.cmake:279 (message):
  Error generating file 
  /home/xx/tools/pytorch/build/caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/__/aten/src/THC/./caffe2_gpu_generated_THCBlas.cu.o


make[2]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2_gpu.dir/__/aten/src/THC/caffe2_gpu_generated_THCBlas.cu.o] Error 1
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
[ 61%] Building CXX object caffe2/torch/lib/THD/CMakeFiles/THD.dir/base/data_channels/DataChannelNccl.cpp.o
/home/xx/tools/pytorch/c10/Half-inl.h(21): error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined

[ 61%] Building CXX object caffe2/torch/lib/THD/CMakeFiles/THD.dir/base/data_channels/DataChannelTCP.cpp.o
/home/xx/tools/pytorch/c10/Half-inl.h(21): error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined

/home/xx/tools/pytorch/c10/Half-inl.h(21): error: identifier "__half_as_short" is undefined

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

## Environment


 - PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.0): commit 8fafa7b6aca1343ca19f6c01e99c7dec1233e8d5
 - OS (e.g., Linux):CentOS release 6.6 (Final)
 - How you installed PyTorch (`conda`, `pip`, source): source
 - Build command you used (if compiling from source): described above
 - Python version:Python 3.6.7 :: Anaconda
 - CUDA/cuDNN version: 7.5
 - GPU models and configuration: Nvidis Tesla K40m
 - Any other relevant information:
gcc version: gcc (GCC) 4.8.2

## Additional context

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
